citeinfo.origin: Asia Pacific Spatial Data Project (APSDP), formerly ACASIAN or Australian Centre of the Asian Spatial Information and Analysis Network
citeinfo.title: Administrative Regions, Level Two - North Korea

descript.abstract: This layer contains the administrative boundaries and regions for ADM2 shi and kun (Municipalities and Districts - the same Korean term is used at both ADM1 and ADM2 levels) of North Korea. These boundary data were compiled from a variety of published map sources in Korean, Chinese, and English with various dates of publication, but are all current to 1998. The internal boundary data are fitted to the Digital Chart of the World coastlines and international boundaries (ponet).
descript.purpose: These data are intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and to provide users with geographic data to display and analyze political and administrative regions in North Korea. Data may also be used for cartography, local and regional planning analysis, urban and rural policy-making, environmental monitoring, economic analysis and other types of geographic analysis. Data can be used with geographic information systems (GIS) software to display and analyze information on political, economic and associated areas of interest, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.
descript.supplinf: Data originally supplied in ARC/INFO 7.2 export format (.e00), and are projected in decimal degrees using the WGS84 Spheroid/Datum. Polgons in this layer, the ADM2 Shi/kun level, four digit codes are employed, the first two being the same as for the shi and do to which the ADM2 shi and kun belong, and the following two digits being assigned according to a similar scheme that gives shi final digits beginning with 0 (xx01, xx02, etc.) and kun ones that begin with 1 or 2 (xx11, ., xx20, etc). Where necessary to allow for more places than there are available numbers, letters starting with a, b, c, etc., have occasionally been substituted for numbers.

idinfo.accconst: Access is granted to licensee (Harvard University) only.

cntaddr.address: School of International Business & Asian Studies

idinfo.datacred: Spatial data produced at the Asia Pacific Spatial Data Project (formerly known as the Australian Centre of the Asian Spatial Information and Analysis Network, ACASIAN) under the direction of Lawrence W. Crissman. Copyright Griffith University.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows NT Version 4.0 (Build 1381) Service Pack 6; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.2.0.700

attracc.attraccr: The names of populated places, administrative regions, railroad stations, and others are provided in Hangul (Korean syllabary), Unofficial romanization, Official romanization and in the Yale romanization system in their respective attribute tables.

procstep.procdesc: The original shape file was imported to an ArcSDE Layer.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypd: ESRI Shapefile. Polygons represent administrative areas

Internally calculated feature perimeter in map units.
